justification: “Daw et al. (2011) proposed a two-stage Markov task to evaluate individual's inclination for MF vs. MB learning.”
The same sentence notes the task is used to gauge “individual's inclination for MF vs. MB learning,” thereby including model-based learning.

“We refine the two-stage Markov task to more effectively distinguish between MF and MB learning in humans… we propose adapting local change adaptation (LoCA)… As in the LoCA task, we can evaluate an individual's inclination for MB and MF learning by measuring their performance at the start of Phase III.”
The quoted passage states that the LoCA-adapted version enables evaluation of “an individual's inclination for MB and MF learning,” thus treating model-based learning as a measured construct.
